LanguageData.LWMDSignoredDueTo: This setting is ignored due to mod {0}
LanguageData.LWMDSVanillaShelvesDesc: Vanilla Shelves cost 20 by default. Vanilla stools cost 25 by default. This seems to me rather silly... Real world cheap shelves cost considerably more than real world cheap chairs. While a full grown pawn weighs more than 2 suits of plate mail armor, shelves are much taller than a stool... The shelves(20) even cost less than a table(28), despite needing 3(or 4) levels! I feel 60 material is a more reasonable amount. BUT - you can go with vanilla value of 20 if you want :)
LanguageData.LWMDSVanillaShelvesCost: New cost of Vanilla Shelves (vanilla is 20, LWM says 60):
LanguageData.LWMDSmakeAllStorageDeepStorageDesc: Treat all storage items (for example, vanilla Shelves) as Deep Storage. Mostly, this doesn't affect much, but it does mean you get DS's fancy inventory tab, so there's that?
LanguageData.LWMDShaulToStorageExplanation: Who Can Use Storage:\nBy default, only Humans (or human-like aliens) have the intelligence required to put things INTO storage: stacking carefully, organizing shelves, manipulating latches, etc.\nANYONE may take FROM storage.
LanguageData.LWMDSrobotsCanUse: Robots can always haul to Deep Storage? (some robots supported)
LanguageData.LWMDSrobotsCanUseDesc: Allow Robots to haul to Deep Storage. Robots from "Misc. Robots" are supported; support for Project RimFactory - Drones is coming.
LanguageData.LWM_DS_IntTitle: Minimum Intelligence Required to Haul to Deep Storage
LanguageData.LWM_DS_IntDesc: This option can let your animals/robots/whatever haul TO Deep Storage.\nMost alien races have "Humanlike" or better. Most animals are "animal." Vanilla Mechanoids are "tool users." Robots from various mods? Your guess is as good as mine, but try Tool Users first and then maybe animals.\nNote that ANYONE may take FROM Deep Storage.
LanguageData.LWM_DS_Int_Humanlike: Humanlike (Humans, most mod-aliens, Default) (LWM * of approval)
LanguageData.LWMDSstoringDelayExplanation: By default, putting things into Deep Storage takes some time (oraganizing). The time required can be a complicated calculation, sometimes including how many kinds of things are in storage and how many things are being put into storage. Using some mods breaks that calculation.
LanguageData.LWMDSstoringTakesTimeLabel: If you really want to TURN OFF the delay while storing, uncheck this.
LanguageData.LWMDSstoringTakesTimeDesc: Turning this off is not how LWM plays. But hey, it's your game! You do you!
LanguageData.LWMDSstoringGlobalScale: Global Storing Time: {0}%\nIf you want to adjust how long it takes pawns to store items (maybe you think it takes too long), you can adjust this setting, and it will apply to all storage units.
LanguageData.LWMDSstoringTimeConsidersStackSize: Does storing time consider stack size? (Stack XXL? Ogre Stack?)
LanguageData.LWMDSstoringTimeConsidersStackSizeDesc: If selected (default), storing 75 of something may take longer than storing 3. This mainly affects Skips. You probably want to turn this OFF if you are using a mod that makes stack sizes really big.
LanguageData.LWMDSdisableMassLimitsDesc: This completely disables checking for mass limits for storage units. It DOES NOT disable the limit on some items being too large for some units (so a small shelf still can't hold a 600kg statue). Requires restart to take effect (and you're lucky to get this at all)
LanguageData.LWM_DS_defaultStoragePriority: Deep Storage defaults to Storage Priority:
LanguageData.LWM_DS_useEjectButtonDesc: Show the Eject button in the Contents tab. Changing this setting takes effect immediately.
LanguageData.LWM_DS_VanillaHasContentsInBrackets: RimWorld 1.4 introduced bracket buttons to select items in shelves. This is great, but if you have 957457 things in storage, the buttons can fill up the screen. You can change the way it works here. NOTE: All settings require a restart to take effect!
LanguageData.LWM_DS_UseVanillaContentsInBracketsDesc: When a storage building is selected, all stored items are available as buttons to select on the bottom of the screen. RESTART NEEDED
LanguageData.LWM_DS_showContentsInBracketsDesc: If this is turned off, none of these will be shown. Less clutter! Faster! Great if you have a large number of various items. RESTART NEEDED
LanguageData.LWM_DS_useDSRightClick: Use Deep Storage custom Right Click
LanguageData.LWM_DS_useDSRightClickDesc: The custom Deep Storage right-click interface SHOULD work, and should make things easier to use - especially in weapons lockers with mods such as Dual Wielding. Disable this to use Vanilla's logic in case something breaks, but it may make some tasks more difficult (e.g., loading caravans). Note: disabling this can break some game mechanics.\n\nRequires restart to take effect.
LanguageData.LWM_DS_Storage_ArchitectMenuAlwaysShowDe: The default place for all Deep Storage units is in the "Storage" category in the Architect Menu. If you change it, by default, the Storage category goes away - and we try to clean up any other "Storage" categories from other mods. Check this if you want it to always be there, even if there are no Deep Storage units in it.
LanguageData.LWM_DS_Storage_ArchitectMenuMoveALLDesc: Check this to move things like vanilla shelves or other mods' storage units to "Storage" too. "Production" storage buildings (like Hoppers) are not moved. REQUIRES RESTART TO FULLY TURN OFF! If you uncheck this, items will end up in "Furniture" until you restart.
LanguageData.LWMDSoverCapacityCheck: Check for storage being Over Capacity
LanguageData.LWMDSoverCapacityCheckDesc:
If more than one thing ends up in a stockpile, pawns need to know to clean it up. Turning this off prevents that.

Turn this OFF to allow some other storage mods to function:
 RimFactory
LanguageData.LWMDSuseOldBoringStackingGraphic: Use older (boring, but tidy) stacking graphic?
LanguageData.LWMDSuseOldBoringStackingGraphicDesc: Starting in RW 1.4, items in storage are stacked so that every item is visible. Many people find this untidy, ugly, overly busy, or irritating. Select this option to use the old graphics, where all items were directly on top of each other. NOTE: REQUIRES RESTART TO TAKE EFFECT
LanguageData.LWMDSperDSUSettings: EXPERIMENTAL: Change Storage Settings for each type of Unit: Caution
LanguageData.LWMDSperDSUturnOnDesc: This lets you edit the properties of each Deep Storage building! Don't break anything, okay? TURNING THIS OFF WILL RESET ALL SETTINGS TO DEFAULT.
LanguageData.LWMDSperDSUWarning: Note: No settings will be saved unless you turn on this feature above!
LanguageData.LWMDSpDSUshowContents: Show contents for this type of building
LanguageData.LWMDSpDSUoverlay: What kind of count overlay (little white numbers) to use
LanguageData.LWMDSpDSUstoragePriority: Default Storage Priority for this building
LanguageData.LWMDSpDSUchangeFilterQ: Change what Items are allowed in this building?
LanguageData.LWMDSpDSUchangeFilterQDesc: If you are NOT using a custom list of items here, you should uncheck this.
LanguageData.LWMDS_ApplyChangesToGroup: These changes apply to all {0} members of the group
LanguageData.LWMDS_ApplyChangesToGroupDesc: This storage building is part of a group of {0} members - all of the members' settings will update to match these when you change them!
LanguageData.LWMDS_PerBuildingSettingsDesc: Changing any of these settings will only affect THIS building (and its storage group, if it has one). All others will not be affected - if you want to change settings for all units of this type, use the Mod Options
LanguageData.LWMDS_DefaultRemoveNameDesc: This storage unit is part of a named group. If there is only one unit in the group, you can REMOVE the name here - it will no longer show up as a destination for bills. Otherwise, you may set the group to a DEFAULT name.
